intro: Tolpis barbata, commonly known as the hairy tolpis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in full sun and well-drained soils. Its distinctive feature is the hairy texture of its stems and leaves, which gives it its common name. Tolpis barbata produces small yellow flowers that bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
